feedback:
Excellent application of the DRIVER framework throughout your work. You clearly demonstrated 6 stages: D, R, I, V, E, R2.


STRENGTHS:
- Financial APP: The submission clearly implements a working tool focused on financial decisions (salary negotiations), generates actionable outputs (scripts, risk labels), and logs interactions—evidence of functioning financial application. DISCOVER and IMPLEMENT stages show problem definition and concrete execution; REFLECT confirms the tool's intended financial use and completeness.
- Integrate AI: The submission shows a substantive, multi-component AI integration (model + memory + logging + roleplay + risk labeling) that adds clear user value and safety considerations. DISCOVER and IMPLEMENT evidence demonstrate both intent and concrete execution, and REFLECT confirms meaningful benefit, meeting the PASS standard.

criteria.criterion_name: Financial APP: The tool functions as a financial application.
evidence: ["the goal was to create a tool that can help users prepare for salary negotiations and evaluate the level of risk in negotiating different strategies or when it comes to negotiating utilizing different strategies"]
["and at the same time, the workflow is going to be logged into my Google sheet."]

["In summary, my AI negotiation tool meets all the project requirements. It uses an AI model, memory tools, and real life um real time data logging. It's interactive, practical, and demonstrates how AI can support financial negotiation decisions."]
criteria.driver_alignment: DISCOVER: student framed the problem as salary negotiation prep and risk evaluation (first quote). IMPLEMENT: student demonstrated execution and logging to Google Sheets (second quote). REFLECT: student summarizes the tool meeting requirements and its value as a financial negotiation aid (third quote).
criteria.reasoning: The submission clearly implements a working tool focused on financial decisions (salary negotiations), generates actionable outputs (scripts, risk labels), and logs interactions—evidence of functioning financial application. DISCOVER and IMPLEMENT stages show problem definition and concrete execution; REFLECT confirms the tool's intended financial use and completeness.

criteria.criterion_name: Integrate AI: The tool integrates AI capabilities effectively.
evidence: "All right. Hello everyone. My name is Kevin Sales and for this mini project, I built an AI powered negotiation assistant using N and Open AI. And the goal was to create a tool that can help users prepare for salary negotiations and evaluate the level of risk in negotiating different strategies or when it comes to negotiating utilizing different strategies."

"So, my workflow has four main components. when chats are received AI agent using open um AI GPT 4.1 mini simple memory and Google sheets interrogation and when chats are received so this just essentially triggers the workflow and the AI agent this will be the brain of the system and the simple memory is just there so it stores the session context..."
"…this makes the tool just feel more like a real life negotiation coach."
criteria.driver_alignment: DISCOVER: The student identifies a clear problem and AI-driven goal (preparing users for negotiations and risk evaluation). IMPLEMENT: Describes concrete system components (GPT-4.1 mini agent, session memory, Google Sheets logging) and demonstrated outputs (scripts, risk labels). REFLECT: Notes user-facing value (roleplay coach feel), showing insight into AI’s contribution.
criteria.reasoning: The submission shows a substantive, multi-component AI integration (model + memory + logging + roleplay + risk labeling) that adds clear user value and safety considerations. DISCOVER and IMPLEMENT evidence demonstrate both intent and concrete execution, and REFLECT confirms meaningful benefit, meeting the PASS standard.
